name: ResolverTransformer
comment:
Transformer mixin which automatically gets and releases resolvers.

To use mix this class in, set the resolvers field and override code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.applyResolver.

resolvers.name: resolvers
resolvers.comment: The cache of resolvers- must be set from subclass.

apply.name: apply
apply.comment:
This provides a default implementation of Transformer.apply that will get and release resolvers automatically. Internally this: * Gets a resolver associated with the transform primary input. * Does resolution to the code starting from that input. * Calls code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.applyResolver. * Then releases the resolver.

Use code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.applyToEntryPoints instead if you need to override the entry points to run the resolver on.

applyResolver.name: applyResolver
applyResolver.comment:
Invoked when the resolver is ready to be processed.

Return a Future to indicate when apply is completed.

applyToEntryPoints.name: applyToEntryPoints
applyToEntryPoints.comment:
Helper function to make it easy to write an Transformer.apply method that automatically gets and releases the resolver. This is typically used as follows:

Future apply(Transform transform) {

  var entryPoints = ...; // compute entry points
  return applyToEntryPoints(transform, entryPoints);

}

isPrimary.name: isPrimary
isPrimary.comment:
By default only process prossible entry point assets.

This is only a preliminary check based on the asset ID.

shouldApplyResolver.name: shouldApplyResolver
shouldApplyResolver.comment:
Check to see if this should apply with the resolver on the provided asset.

By default this will only apply on possible Dart entry points (see code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.isPossibleDartEntry).

allowedExtensions.name: allowedExtensions
allowedExtensions.comment:
Override this to return a space-separated list of file extensions that are allowed for the primary inputs to this transformer.

Each extension must begin with a leading ..

If you don't override code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.isPrimary yourself, it defaults to allowing any asset whose extension matches one of the ones returned by this. If you don't override code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.isPrimary or this, it allows all files.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

apply.name: apply
apply.comment:
Run this transformer on on the primary input specified by code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.apply.transform.

The code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.apply.transform is used by the code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.Transformer for two purposes (in addition to accessing the primary input). It can call getInput() to request additional input assets. It also calls addOutput() to provide generated assets back to the system. Either can be called multiple times, in any order.

In other words, a Transformer's job is to find all inputs for a transform, starting at the primary input, then generate all output assets and yield them back to the transform.

isPrimary.name: isPrimary
isPrimary.comment:
Returns true if code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.isPrimary.id can be a primary input for this transformer.

While a transformer can read from multiple input files, one must be the "primary" input. This asset determines whether the transformation should be run at all. If the primary input is removed, the transformer will no longer be run.

A concrete example is dart2js. When you run dart2js, it will traverse all of the imports in your Dart source files and use the contents of all of those to generate the final JS. However you still run dart2js "on" a single file: the entrypoint Dart file that has your main() method. This entrypoint file would be the primary input.

If this is not overridden, defaults to allow any asset whose extension matches one of the ones returned by code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.allowedExtensions. If that is not overridden, allows all assets.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of code_transformers/code_transformers-resolver.ResolverTransformer.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
